english_translation: They properly burnt upon those fires burning with libations of clarified butter poured in torrents over them, the bodies of Duryodhana and his hundred brothers, of Shalya, and Shala, and king Bhruishravas; of king Jayadratha and Abhimanyu, O Bharata; of Dussasana's son and Lakshmana and king Dhrishtaketu; of Vrihanta and Somadatta and the hundreds of Srinjayas; of king Khemadhanvan and Virata and Drupada; of Shikhandin the prince of Panchalas, and Dhirishtadyumna of Prisata's race; of the valiant Yudhamanyu and Uttamaujas; of the ruler of the Kosalas, the sons of Draupadi, and Shakuni the son of Subala; of Achala and Vrisaka, and king Bhagadatta; of Karna and his son of great wrath; of those great bowmen, viz., the Kekaya princes, and those mighty carwarriors, viz., the Trigartas; of Ghatotkacha the prince of Rakshasas, and the brother of Vaka; of Alamvusha, that best of Rakshasas, and king Jalasandha; and of hundreds and thousands of others kings.

source_text: बृहन्तं सोमदत्तं सृञ्जयांश्च शताधिकान्। राजानं क्षेमधन्वानं विराटद्रुपदौ तथा॥३३॥

source_text: पितृमेधाश्च केषाञ्चित्प्रावर्तन्त महात्मनाम्। सामभिश्चाप्यगायन्त तेऽन्वशोचन्त चापरैः॥३९॥
matched_target_text: पितृमेधाश्च केषांचित् प्रावर्तन्त महात्मनाम्। सामभिश्चाप्यगायन्त तेऽन्वशोचन्त चापरैः॥
english_translation: The Pitri-medha rites in honor of some of the great persons who were dead were performed there, while some sang Samans, and some cried for the dead.

source_text: साम्नामृचां च नादेन स्त्रीणां च रुदितस्वनैः। कश्मलं सर्वभूतानां निशायां समपद्यत॥४०॥
matched_target_text: साम्नामृचां च नादेन स्त्रीणां च रुदितस्वनैः। कश्मलं सर्वभूतानां निशायां समपद्यत॥
english_translation: With the loud sound of Samans and Richs, and the cries of the women, all creatures became stupefied that night.

source_text: ते विधूमाः प्रदीप्ताश्च दीप्यमानाश्च पावकाः। नभसीवान्वदृश्यन्त ग्रहास्तन्वभ्रसंवृताः॥४१॥
matched_target_text: ते विधूमाः प्रदीप्ताश्च दीप्यमानाश्च पावकाः। नभसीवान्वदृश्यन्त ग्रहास्तन्वभ्रसंवृताः॥
english_translation: The funeral fires, smokeless and burning brightly looked like shining planets in the sky enveloped by clouds.

source_text: ये चाप्यनाथास्तत्रासन्नानादेशसमागताः। तांश्च सर्वान्समानाय्य राशीन्कृत्वा सहस्रशः॥४२॥
matched_target_text: ये चाप्यनाथास्तत्रासन् नानादेशसमागताः। तांश्च सर्वान् समानाय्य राशीन् कृत्वा सहस्रशः॥
english_translation: Those among the dead that had hailed from various kingdoms and had no friends, were collected together in thousands of heaps and, at the command of Yudhishthira, were caused to be burnt by Vidura with the help a large number of persons acting coolly out of goodwill and affection, on pyres made of dry wood.

source_text: भूषणान्युत्तरीयाणि वेष्टनान्यवमुच्य च। ततः पितॄणां भ्रातॄणां पौत्राणां स्वजनस्य च॥२॥
matched_target_text: भूषणान्युत्तरीयाणि वेष्टनान्यवमुच्य च। ततः पितॄणां भ्रातॄणां पौत्राणां स्वजनस्य च॥
english_translation: Vaishampayana said Arrived at the holy Ganga full of sacred water, containing many lakes, adorned with high banks and broad shores, and having a vest bed, they threw off their ornaments, upper garments, and belts and girdles. The Kuru ladies, crying and stricken with great sorrow offered oblations of water of their fathers and grandsons and brothers and kinsmen and sons and seniors and husbands. Conversant with duties, they also performed the water-rite for their friends.

source_text: पुत्राणामार्यकाणां च पतीनां च कुरुस्त्रियः। उदकं चक्रिरे सर्वा रुदन्त्यो भृशदुःखिताः॥३॥
matched_target_text: पुत्राणामार्यकाणां च पतीनां च कुरुस्त्रियः। उदकं चक्रिरे सर्वा रुदत्यो भृशदुःखिताः॥
english_translation: Vaishampayana said Arrived at the holy Ganga full of sacred water, containing many lakes, adorned with high banks and broad shores, and having a vest bed, they threw off their ornaments, upper garments, and belts and girdles. The Kuru ladies, crying and stricken with great sorrow offered oblations of water of their fathers and grandsons and brothers and kinsmen and sons and seniors and husbands. Conversant with duties, they also performed the water-rite for their friends.

source_text: सुहृदां चापि धर्मज्ञाः प्रचक्रुः सलिलक्रियाः। उदके क्रियमाणे तु वीराणां वीरपत्निभिः॥४॥
matched_target_text: सुहृदां चापि धर्मज्ञाः प्रचक्रुः सलिलक्रियाः। उदके क्रियमाणे तु वीराणां वीरपत्निभिः॥ सूपतीर्था भवद्गङ्गा भूयो विप्रससार च।
english_translation: While those wives of heroes were performing this rite in honour of their heroic husband, the access to the stream became easy, although the paths (carved out by feet) disappeared afterwards.

source_text: सूपतीर्थाऽभवद्गङ्गा भूयो विप्रससार च। तन्महोदधिसङ्काशं निरानन्दमनुत्सवम्॥५॥
matched_target_text: सुहृदां चापि धर्मज्ञाः प्रचक्रुः सलिलक्रियाः। उदके क्रियमाणे तु वीराणां वीरपत्निभिः॥ सूपतीर्था भवद्गङ्गा भूयो विप्रससार च।
english_translation: While those wives of heroes were performing this rite in honour of their heroic husband, the access to the stream became easy, although the paths (carved out by feet) disappeared afterwards.

source_text: वीरपत्नीभिराकीर्णं गङ्गातीरमशोभत। ततः कुन्ती महाराज सहसा शोककर्शिता॥६॥
matched_target_text: तन्महोदधिसंकाशं निरानन्दमनुत्सवम्॥ वीरपत्नीभिराकीर्णं गङ्गातीरमशोभत।
english_translation: The shores of their river though crowded with those wives of heroes, looked as broad as the ocean and presented a sorrow of sorrow and cheerlessness.

source_text: रुदती मन्दया वाचा पुत्रान्वचनमब्रवीत्। यः स वीरो महेष्वासो रथयूथपयूथपः॥७॥
matched_target_text: ततः कुन्ती महाराज सहसा शोककर्शिता॥ रुदती मन्दया वाचा पुत्रान् वंचनमब्रवीत्।
english_translation: Then Kunti, O king, laden with grief, weepingly addressed her sons in these soft words.

source_text: अर्जुनेन जितः सङ्ख्ये वीरलक्षणलक्षितः। यं सूतपुत्रं मन्यध्वं राधेयमिति पाण्डवाः॥८॥
matched_target_text: अर्जुनेनं जित: संख्ये वीरलक्षणलक्षितः। यं सूतपुत्रं मन्यध्वं राधेयमिति पाण्डवाः॥
english_translation: That hero and great bowman, that chief of many car-divisions, that heroic warrior who has been killed by Arjuna in battle, that warrior whom, ye sons of Pandu, you knew as the son of the charioteer Radha, that hero who shone in the midst of his army like the Sun himself, who fought with all of you and your followers, who shone as he commanded the vast army of Duryodhana, who had no equal on Earth in energy, that hero who preferred glory to life, that brave warrior firm in truth and never fatigued with exertion, was your eldest brother! Offer oblations of water to that eldest brother of yours who was born of me by the Sun! That hero was born with a pair of earrings and clad in armour, and took after the Sun-God himself in effulgence.

source_text: यो व्यराजच्चमूमध्ये दिवाकर इव प्रभुः। प्रत्ययुध्यत वः सर्वान्पुरा यः सपदानुगान्॥९॥

english_translation: That hero and great bowman, that chief of many car-divisions, that heroic warrior who has been killed by Arjuna in battle, that warrior whom, ye sons of Pandu, you knew as the son of the charioteer Radha, that hero who shone in the midst of his army like the Sun himself, who fought with all of you and your followers, who shone as he commanded the vast army of Duryodhana, who had no equal on Earth in energy, that hero who preferred glory to life, that brave warrior firm in truth and never fatigued with exertion, was your eldest brother! source_text: कुण्डली कवची शूरो दिवाकरसमप्रभः। श्रुत्वा तु पाण्डवाः सर्वे मातुर्वचनमप्रियम्॥१३॥
matched_target_text: कुण्डली कवची शूरो दिवाकरसमप्रभः।
english_translation: That hero and great bowman, that chief of many car-divisions, that heroic warrior who has been killed by Arjuna in battle, that warrior whom, ye sons of Pandu, you knew as the son of the charioteer Radha, that hero who shone in the midst of his army like the Sun himself, who fought with all of you and your followers, who shone as he commanded the vast army of Duryodhana, who had no equal on Earth in energy, that hero who preferred glory to life, that brave warrior firm in truth and never fatigued with exertion, was your eldest brother! Offer oblations of water to that eldest brother of yours who was born of me by the Sun! That hero was born with a pair of earrings and clad in armour, and took after the Sun-God himself in effulgence.

additional_matches.target_text: श्रुत्वा तु पाण्डवाः सर्वे मातुर्वचनमप्रियम्॥ कर्णमेवानुशोचन्तो भूयः क्लान्ततराभवन्।

source_text: कर्णमेवानुशोचन्तो भूयः क्लान्ततराऽभवन्। ततः स पुरुषव्याघ्रः कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः॥१४॥
matched_target_text: श्रुत्वा तु पाण्डवाः सर्वे मातुर्वचनमप्रियम्॥ कर्णमेवानुशोचन्तो भूयः क्लान्ततराभवन्।
english_translation: Hearing these painful words of their mother, the Pandavas began to grieve for Karna. Indeed, they became more afflicted then ever.

source_text: उवाच मातरं वीरो निःश्वसन्निव पन्नगः। यः शरोर्मिर्ध्वजावर्तो महाभुजमहाग्रहः॥१५॥
matched_target_text: उवाच मातरं वीरो निःश्वसन्निव पन्नगः। यः शरोमिर्ध्वजावर्तो महाभुजमहाग्रहः॥
english_translation: Then that foremost of men, viz., the heroic Yudhishthira, sighing like a snake asked his mother,-'Were you the mother of that Karna who was like a sea having arrows for his billows, his tall standard for his vortex, his own mighty arms for a couple of huge alligators, his large car for his deep lake, and the sound of his palms or his tempestuous roar, and whose force none could withstand except Dlananjaya? How was that son resembling a very god born of you in former days?

source_text: तलशब्दानुनदितो महारथमहाह्लदः। यस्येषुपातमासाद्य नान्यस्तिष्ठेद्धनञ्जयात्॥१६॥
matched_target_text: तलशब्दानुनदितो महारथमहाह्रदः। यस्येषुपातमासाद्य नान्यस्तिष्ठेद् धनंजयात्॥
english_translation: Then that foremost of men, viz., the heroic Yudhishthira, sighing like a snake asked his mother,-'Were you the mother of that Karna who was like a sea having arrows for his billows, his tall standard for his vortex, his own mighty arms for a couple of huge alligators, his large car for his deep lake, and the sound of his palms or his tempestuous roar, and whose force none could withstand except Dlananjaya? How was that son resembling a very god born of you in former days?

source_text: कथं पुत्रो भवत्याः स देवगर्भः पुराऽभवत्। यस्य बाहुप्रतापेन तापिताः सर्वतो वयम्॥१७॥
matched_target_text: कथं पुत्रो भवत्याः स देवगर्भः पुराभवत्।
english_translation: Then that foremost of men, viz., the heroic Yudhishthira, sighing like a snake asked his mother,-'Were you the mother of that Karna who was like a sea having arrows for his billows, his tall standard for his vortex, his own mighty arms for a couple of huge alligators, his large car for his deep lake, and the sound of his palms or his tempestuous roar, and whose force none could withstand except Dlananjaya? How was that son resembling a very god born of you in former days?

additional_matches.target_text: यस्य बाहुप्रतापेन तापिताः सर्वतो वयम्॥ तमग्निमिव वस्त्रेण कथं छादितवत्यसि।

source_text: तमग्निमिव वस्त्रेण कथं छादितवत्यसि। यस्य बाहुबलं नित्यं धार्तराष्ट्रैरुपासितम्॥१८॥
matched_target_text: यस्य बाहुप्रतापेन तापिताः सर्वतो वयम्॥ तमग्निमिव वस्त्रेण कथं छादितवत्यसि।
english_translation: The power of his arms scorched all of us! How, O mother, could you conceal him like a person concealing a fire within the folds of his cloth?

source_text: उपासितं यथाऽस्माभिर्बलं गाण्डीवधन्वनः। भूमिपानां च सर्वेषां बलं बलवतां वरः॥१९॥
matched_target_text: यस्य बाहुबलं नित्यं धार्तराष्ट्ररुपासितम्॥ उपासितं यथास्माभिर्बलं गाण्डीवधन्वनः।
english_translation: His might of arms was always adored by the Dhritarashtras even as we always worship the might of the wilder of Gandiva.

source_text: नान्यं कुन्तीसुतात्कर्णादगृह्णाद्रथिनां रथी। स नः प्रथमजो भ्राता सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः॥२०॥
matched_target_text: भूमिपानां च सर्वेषां बलं बलवतां वरः॥ नान्यः कुन्तीसुतात् कर्णादगृह्णाद् रथिनां रथी।
english_translation: How was that foremost of powerful men, that first of car-warriors, who fought the united force of all the kings in battle, how was he a son of yours?

source_text: असूत तं भवत्यग्रे कथमद्भुतविक्रमम्। अहो भवत्या मन्त्रस्य गूहनेन वयं हताः॥२१॥
matched_target_text: स नः प्रथमजो भ्राता सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः॥ असूत तं भवत्यग्रे कथमद्भुतविक्रमम्।
english_translation: Was that foremost of all holders of weapons our eldest brother? How did you give birth to that child of wonderful prowess?

source_text: निधनेन हि कर्णस्य पीडितास्तु सबान्धवाः। अभिमन्योर्विनाशेन द्रौपदेयवधेन च॥२२॥
matched_target_text: अहो भवत्या मन्त्रस्य गृहनेन वयं हताः॥ निधनेन हि कर्णस्य पीडितास्तु सबान्धवाः।
english_translation: Alas, for your concealing this fact we have been undone! By the death of Karna, ourselves with all our friends have been greatly sorry.

source_text: पाञ्चालानां विनाशेन कुरूणां पतनेन च। ततः शतगुणं दुःखमिदं मामस्पृशद्भृशम्॥२३॥
matched_target_text: पञ्चालानां विनाशेन कुरूणां पतनेन च। ततः शतगुणं दुःखमिदं मामस्पृशद् मशम्॥
english_translation: The grief I fell at Karna's death is a hundred times great than that felt for the death of Abhimanyu and the sons of Draupadi, and the destruction of the Panchalas and the Kurus! Thinking of Karna, I am burning with grief, like a person thrown into a burning fire.

source_text: कर्णमेवानुशोचापि दह्याम्यग्नाविवाहितः। नेह स्म किञ्चिदप्राप्य भवेदपि दिवि स्थितम्॥२४॥
matched_target_text: कर्णमेवानुशोचामि दह्याम्यग्नाविवाहितः। नेह स्म किंचिदप्राप्यं भवेदपि दिवि स्थितम्॥ न चेदं वैशसं घोरं कौरवान्तकरं भवेत्।
english_translation: Nothing could have been unattainable by us, not excepting things belonging to the celestial region. Alas, this terrible carnage, so destructive of the Kurus, would not have taken place.

source_text: न चेदं वैशसं घोरं कौरवान्तकरं भवेत्। एवं विलप्य बहुलं धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः॥२५॥
matched_target_text: एवं विलप्य बहुलं धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः॥ व्यरुदच्छनकै राजंश्चकारास्योदकं प्रभुः।
english_translation: Thus bewailing, king Yudhishthira the just uttered loud wails of woe. The powerful king then offered oblations of water to his deceased elder brother.

source_text: व्यरुदच्छनकै राजंश्चकारास्योदकं प्रभुः। ततो विनेदुः सहसा स्त्रियस्ताः खलु सर्वशः॥२६॥
matched_target_text: एवं विलप्य बहुलं धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः॥ व्यरुदच्छनकै राजंश्चकारास्योदकं प्रभुः।
english_translation: Thus bewailing, king Yudhishthira the just uttered loud wails of woe. The powerful king then offered oblations of water to his deceased elder brother.

source_text: अभितो याः स्थितास्तत्र तस्मिन्नुदककर्मणि। तत आनाययामास कर्णस्य सपरिच्छदाः॥२७॥
matched_target_text: ततो विनेदुः सहसा स्त्रियस्ताः खलु सर्वशः॥ अभितो याः स्थितास्तत्र तस्मिन्नुदककर्मणि।
english_translation: Then all the ladies that crowded the shores of the river suddenly cried aloud.

source_text: स्त्रियः कुरुपतिर्धीमान्भ्रातुः प्रेम्णा युधिष्ठिरः। स ताभिः सह धर्मात्मा प्रेतकृत्यमनन्तरम्॥२८॥
matched_target_text: तत आनाययामास कर्णस्य सपरिच्छदाः॥ स्त्रियः कुरुपति/मान् भ्रातुः प्रेम्णा युधिष्ठिरः।
english_translation: The intelligent king of the Kurus, viz., Yudhishthira, had the wives and members of Karna's family brought before him.

source_text: चकार विधिवद्धीमान्धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः। पापेनासौ मया श्रेष्ठो भ्राता ज्ञातिर्निपातितः॥२९॥
matched_target_text: चकार विधिवद् धीमान् धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः। पापेनासौ मया श्रेष्ठो भ्राता ज्ञातिनिपातितः। अतो मनसि यद् गुह्यं स्त्रीणां तन्न भविष्यति॥
english_translation: The righteous-souled king performed, with them the water-rite in honor of his eldest brother. Having finished the ceremony, the king, with his mind greatly agitated, rose from the waters of Ganga."

source_text: अतो मनसि यद्गुह्यं स्त्रीणां तन्न भविष्यति। इत्युक्त्वा स तु गङ्गाया उत्तताराकुलेन्द्रियः। भ्रातृभिः सहितः सर्वैर्गङ्गातीरमुपेयिवान्॥३०॥
matched_target_text: इत्युक्त्वा स तु गङ्गाया उत्तताराकुलेन्द्रियः। भ्रातृभिः सहितः सर्वैर्गङ्गातीरमुपेयिवान्॥
english_translation: The righteous-souled king performed, with them the water-rite in honor of his eldest brother. Having finished the ceremony, the king, with his mind greatly agitated, rose from the waters of Ganga."
